alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Clearfield; Elk; McKean; Potter; Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 12 at 4:14AM EST until January 13 at 9:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Southeast winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts between 45 and 55 mph this afternoon and evening. The wind will subside for several hours late tonight before shifting to the West-Southwest Saturday then increasing to 20 to 30 mph with gusts between 45 and 55 mph throughout the day Saturday. * WHERE...Warren, McKean, Potter, Elk, Cameron and Clearfield Counties. * WHEN...From noon today to 9 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There will be a several hour lull in the wind late tonight and early Saturday morning between the strong Southeast winds and the later, post cold frontal West-Southwest winds on Saturday.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. For high wind safety information, visit weather.gov/wind. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
